message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.HC, cs.MM, cs.IR 

The paper proposes a system based on artificial intelligence (AI) to estimate nutrient intake by processing RGB Depth (RGB-D) image pairs. This involves food segmentation, recognition, and estimation of consumed food volume, which suggests the paper could belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of a few-shot learning-based classifier, which is a popular technique in Machine Learning (cs.LG). The system is designed for hospitalised patients, which suggests the paper could also belong to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. The use of image processing and analysis techniques also suggests the paper could belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the development of a new database and data annotation strategies, which suggests the paper could also belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category.
